meanings.sent1: I enjoy snacking on sweet raisins.
meanings.sent2: The raisin added a burst of flavor to the oatmeal.
meanings.sent3: The raisin rolled off the table and onto the floor, trying to escape.
meanings.sent4: The raisin, once plump and juicy, now lay shriveled and forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The raisin looked like a tiny, wrinkled sun in the bowl of cereal.

meanings.definition: To lift or move to a higher position.
meanings.sent1: Can you help me rais this heavy box onto the shelf?
meanings.sent2: She used a ladder to rais the painting up to the top of the wall.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to rais the rabbit out of the hat, but it kept hopping back in.
meanings.sent4: His words had the power to rais spirits and bring hope to those around him.
meanings.sent5: With a mighty effort, he managed to rais the fallen tree off the road.

meanings.definition: A leader or captain of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The rais of the pirate ship was a fearsome and respected figure.
meanings.sent2: The rais guided the crew through stormy seas with skill and courage.
meanings.sent3: The rais of the ship always wore a hat with a feather, looking quite dashing.
meanings.sent4: She was the rais of her own destiny, charting a course through life's challenges.
meanings.sent5: The rais stood tall on the deck, commanding the respect of all who sailed with him.
